scenes.text:
The bachelors chemistry course is a 3 year course which provides a broad introduction to chemistry. The course offers students to explore their interests through optional modules and research projects.

Content is taught through a series of lectures, tutorials, workshops and practical classes. These are also heavily support through materials hosted online by the school through learning central.

First year 
First year will provide a foundation for all students. The core modules in first year are based around 5 principle subject areas: 
analytical inorganic, organic, physical and solid state chemistry
Aswell as optional modules such as drug development 

Second year
Second year content will develop a deeper understanding within modules from first year helping students to consolidate and practice their skills.

Third year
In year 3 students undertake a substantial research project during the spring semester.
Students will also take a compulsory theory module in four branches of the subject and select from a range of optional modules.

The chemistry bsc course offers a placement year in industry or the opportunity for students to study abroad for a year. 
These opportunities will be undertaken during the 3rd year.

Work placements are usually based in the UK however we do allow opportunities for overseas industrial placements. You will effectively be an employee of the company with whom you are placed, and you will conduct chemistry-related activities. We encourage you to look for your own placements however we will share opportunities and offer support.

Studying abroad will involve students to undertake a project under the supervision of an english speaking member of staff. The school will be here to support and help you find a placement and will remain in close contact throughout your placement.

Graduate chemists have an array of career options. Many join the chemical industry, while others enter academia or government establishments.

Potential graduate careers include:
- Product Development Chemist
- Patent Analyst
- Quality Control Scientist
- Chemical Engineer
- Academic Researcher
